pull.title: refactor: Avoid passing params where not needed
pull.body:
It seems confusing to pass chain params, consensus params, or a time function around when it is not needed.

Fix this by:

* Inlining the passed time getter function. I don't see a use case why this should be mockable.
* Using `chainman.GetConsensus()` or `chainman.GetParams()`, where possible.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25073](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25073) (test: Cleanup miner_tests by MarcoFalke)
* [#25064](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25064) ([kernel 2b/n] Add `ChainstateManager::m_adjusted_time_callback` by dongcarl)
* [#24474](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24474) (Additional thread safety annotations for CNode/Peer by ajtowns)
* [#24232](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24232) (assumeutxo: add init and completion logic by jamesob)
* [#23443](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23443) (p2p: Erlay support signaling by naumenkogs)
* [#21527](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21527) (net_processing: lock clean up by ajtowns)
* [#21006](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21006) (rpc: reduce LOCK(cs_min) scope in rest_block: ~5 times as many requests per second by martinus)
* [#18933](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18933) (rpc: Add submit option to generateblock by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
post-merge ACK. This synergizes well with some of the upcoming `libbitcoinkernel` changes. We might actually be able to remove all references to a global `CChainParams` :astonished: (no promises tho)
